I always install AppBar on any new system I set up. It's the easiest, most convenient, most unobtrusive and most memory-frugal launcher app I know of, and I must have tried them all over the past ten years. I kind of wish it had a sub-menu level, but otherwise it's perfect. Hey - me too! I always install AppBar on any new system I set up. It’s the easiest, most convenient, most unobtrusive and most memory-frugal launcher app I know of, and I must have tried them all over the past ten years. I kind of wish it had a sub-menu level, but otherwise it’s perfect.

]]> Comment on Next Generation AV by Jarod http://www.perham.net/mike/log/?p=897&cpage=1#comment-77370 Jarod Thu, 12 Feb 2009 01:14:36 +0000 http://www.perham.net/mike/log/?p=897#comment-77370 I modded my brothers old xbox (1) a couple months back & am running XBMC on it. I'm pulling everything from my NAS with a 1TB disk attached. The NAS is just a NSLU2 which will run LOTS of servers & apps (google it). XBMC on the xbox is pretty cool, except it doesn't have the power needed to do 1080p. The better solution I think is to build a small HTPC & run XBMC for win/osx/linux. I modded my brothers old xbox (1) a couple months back & am running XBMC on it. I’m pulling everything from my NAS with a 1TB disk attached. The NAS is just a NSLU2 which will run LOTS of servers & apps (google it). XBMC on the xbox is pretty cool, except it doesn’t have the power needed to do 1080p. The better solution I think is to build a small HTPC & run XBMC for win/osx/linux.

]]> Comment on Insignia NS-HD2114 review by Mike Perham http://www.perham.net/mike/log/?p=715&cpage=1#comment-77366 Mike Perham Sat, 07 Feb 2009 15:34:27 +0000 http://www.perham.net/mike/log/?p=715#comment-77366 I'm a little more unhappy with the system these days. I find the system really slow - it takes 10 seconds to boot up, takes 5 seconds to switch functions. I find the alarm annoying because I still don't know how to cancel the alarm! Every Saturday I get woken up. In short, it's got a ton of functionality but does none of it very well. I'd look for something else these days. I’m a little more unhappy with the system these days. I find the system really slow - it takes 10 seconds to boot up, takes 5 seconds to switch functions.

I find the alarm annoying because I still don’t know how to cancel the alarm! Every Saturday I get woken up.

In short, it’s got a ton of functionality but does none of it very well. I’d look for something else these days.
